text: 第1回 第1
translation: Episode 1, Part 1
grammar: 第 + number creates ordinal numbers (第1 = 1st, 第2 = 2nd, etc.)

text: 第7章
translation: Chapter 7
grammar: 第 + number + 章 = Chapter X

text: フラグの強制排除!急いで!
translation: Forced plug ejection! Hurry!
grammar: Te-form command (急いで) used for urgent instructions

text: LCL、緊急排出 / はい! / いいから、ハッチを開けて、早く!
translation: LCL, emergency discharge! / Yes! / Just open the hatch, quickly!
grammar: いいから = 'never mind (that), just...' used for urgent redirecting

text: シンジク!
translation: Shinji-kun!
grammar: Name + くん is a common honorific for addressing boys

text: 次
translation: Next
grammar: Single word used as transition or command

text: 12式飛走急砲消滅
translation: Type-12 flying artillery annihilated
grammar: Noun phrase without particle, technical military terminology

text: なるほどね / これまで採取したデータによりますと / 目標は一定距離内の外敵を自動排除するものと推測されます
translation: I see. / According to the data collected so far / It is presumed that the target automatically eliminates external enemies within a certain distance.
grammar: によりますと = 'according to'; ものと推測される = passive form of 'presumed to be'

text: エリア侵入と同時に下流地方で100%狙い撃ち
translation: 100% targeted fire in the downstream area simultaneously with area intrusion
grammar: と同時に = 'simultaneously with'; compound noun construction for technical description

text: エヴァによる近接戦闘は危険すぎますね / ATフィールドはどう? / 健在です / 相転移空間を肉眼で確認できるほど強力なものが展開されています
translation: Close combat with the Eva is too dangerous. / What about the AT Field? / It's intact. / Something so powerful that the phase transition space can be confirmed with the naked eye is being deployed.
grammar: による = 'by means of'; すぎる = 'too much'; ほど = 'to the extent that'

text: 誘導火砲爆撃などの生半可な攻撃では / 泣きを見るだけですねこりゃ
translation: With half-hearted attacks like guided artillery bombardment / We'll just end up regretting it.

vocabulary.meaning: to regret, to suffer the consequences

grammar: では = 'with/by means of'; だけです = 'just/only'; こりゃ = casual contraction of これは

text: 攻守ともにほぼパーペキ / まさに空中要塞ね / で問題のシールドは
translation: Nearly perfect in both offense and defense / Truly a flying fortress / And what about the problematic drill?
grammar: ともに = 'both'; まさに = 'truly, exactly'; で = connective particle meaning 'so/and'

text: 現在目標は我々の直上 / 第三新東京市ゼロエリアンに進行
translation: Currently the target is directly above us / Advancing toward Tokyo-3 zero area
grammar: に進行 = 'advancing toward'; technical briefing style with minimal particles

text: 直径17.5メートルの巨大シールドが / ジオフロント内ネルフ本部に向かい先行中です
translation: A massive drill 17.5 meters in diameter / is currently proceeding ahead toward NERV headquarters inside the Geofront
grammar: に向かい = 'heading toward'; 中です = progressive form 'currently doing'

text: 敵はここ、ネルフ本部へ直接攻撃を仕掛けるつもりですね。 / しゃらくさい。 / で、到達予想時刻は?
translation: The enemy intends to launch a direct attack here, on NERV headquarters. / How impudent. / So, what's the estimated time of arrival?
grammar: つもり = 'intend to'; しゃらくさい is colloquial expression of annoyance

text: 明朝午前0時06分54秒。
translation: Tomorrow morning at 0:06:54 AM.
grammar: Precise time specification in formal Japanese style

text: その時刻には、22艘全ての装甲防御を貫通して、ネルフ本部へ到達するものと思われます。
translation: At that time, it is believed it will penetrate all 22 layers of armor defense and reach NERV headquarters.
grammar: ものと思われる = formal passive 'it is believed that'; には = 'at (that time)'

text: あと10時間足らずか。
translation: Less than 10 hours remaining then.
grammar: 足らず = 'less than'; か at end = rhetorical confirmation particle

text: 敵シールド第一走行版に接触 / で、こちらの初号機の状況は? / 胸部、第三走行版まで見事に誘拐
translation: Contact with enemy drill at first armor layer / So, what's the status of Unit-01? / Chest area, splendidly gouged down to the third armor layer
grammar: まで = 'up to, as far as'; に = location particle marking contact point

text: 昨日チュースをやられなかったのは不幸中の幸いだわ
translation: It's a blessing in disguise that it didn't hit the core yesterday.

vocabulary.meaning: to be hit, to be done in

vocabulary.reading: ふこうちゅうのさいわい

grammar: なかったのは = nominalizing past negative; 不幸中の幸い = set phrase 'blessing in disguise'

text: あと3秒照射されていたらアウトでしたけど
translation: But if it had been irradiated for 3 more seconds, it would have been out.
grammar: ていたら = conditional past progressive 'if had been doing'; でした = past copula

text: 3時間後には完走作業、終了予定です / 了解、ゼロ号機は?
translation: Repair work is scheduled to be completed in 3 hours / Understood. What about Unit-00?
grammar: には = temporal particle 'by (time)'; 予定です = 'it is scheduled/planned'

text: 再起動自体に問題はありませんが、フィードバックにまだ誤差が残っています
translation: There's no problem with the restart itself, but there are still errors remaining in the feedback.
grammar: 自体に = 'in X itself'; が = subject marker; まだ = 'still'; ています = continuing state

text: 実戦はまだ無理か / 初号機専属パイロットの容態は? / 身体に異常はありません
translation: Real combat is still impossible then? / What's the condition of Unit-01's pilot? / There are no abnormalities in his body.
grammar: 無理か = 'impossible, right?'; に = location particle; ありません = negative polite

text: 神経パルスが0.8上昇していますが / 許容範囲内です
translation: His neural pulse has risen by 0.8 but / it's within acceptable range.
grammar: ています = progressive/continuous state; が = 'but' conjunction; 内 = 'within'

text: 敵シールド到達まであと9時間55分
translation: 9 hours and 55 minutes remaining until enemy drill arrival
grammar: まであと = 'remaining until'; time duration without particles in technical reporting

text: 状況はかんばしくないわね / 白旗でもあげますか?
translation: The situation isn't favorable. / Should we raise a white flag?
grammar: くない = negative adjective; わね = feminine sentence ender; でも = 'even, or something'

text: その前にちょっちやってみたいことがあるの
translation: Before that, there's something I'd like to try.
grammar: ~てみたい expresses wanting to try something; の at the end makes it explanatory/feminine

text: 目標のレンジ外 長長距離からの直接射撃かね / そうです 目標のATフィールドを中はせず / 高エネルギー収束帯による一点突破しか方法はありません / マギはどう言ってる
translation: Direct fire from outside the target's range, from long distance? / That's right. Without neutralizing the target's AT Field / our only method is a single-point breakthrough with a high-energy convergence beam. / What does MAGI say?
grammar: ~による indicates means/method; しか~ない means 'only/nothing but'

text: スーパーコンピューター マギによる回答は / 賛成に条件付き賛成が1でした
translation: The supercomputer MAGI's response was / one approval and one conditional approval.
grammar: ~による indicates the source/agent; でした is polite past tense of だ

text: 賞賛は8.7%か / 最も高い数値です
translation: Success rate is 8.7%? / That's the highest number we have.

vocabulary.meaning: praise, admiration (here likely 成算 'probability of success')

grammar: か at the end indicates a question; です is polite copula

text: 反対する理由はない / やりたまえ カツラギ1 / はい
translation: There's no reason to oppose it. / Do it, Katsuragi. / Yes sir.

vocabulary.meaning: do it (command form with たまえ)

grammar: ~する理由はない means 'no reason to do'; たまえ is a commanding but somewhat polite imperative

text: しかしまた無茶な作戦を立てたものね / 桂木作戦部長さん / 無茶とはまた失礼ね
translation: You've come up with quite a reckless plan again / Operations Director Katsuragi. / How rude to call it reckless.
grammar: ~たものね expresses reflection/admiration; とは emphasizes the preceding word

text: 残り9時間以内で実現可能 / おまけに最も確実なものよ / これがね
translation: It's achievable within the remaining 9 hours / and what's more, it's the most reliable option. / This one is.
grammar: ~以内 means 'within'; の at the end nominalizes the phrase

text: うちのポジトロンライフルじゃそんな大出力に耐えられないわよ / どうすんの / 決まってるでしょ / 借りるのよ / 借りるって / まさか
translation: Our positron rifle can't withstand that kind of high output. / So what will we do? / It's obvious, isn't it? / We'll borrow one. / Borrow? / Don't tell me...
grammar: じゃ is casual for では; ~られない is potential negative form; のよ is feminine explanatory

text: そう 戦時券のプロトタイプ
translation: That's right. The Strategic Self-Defense Force's prototype.
grammar: そう affirms the previous statement

text: 以上の理由により この実装溶電子法は / 本日15時より 特務機関NERVが挑発いたします / かといって しかしそんな無茶な
translation: For the above reasons, this experimental positron cannon / will be requisitioned by Special Agency NERV starting at 15:00 today. / That said... but that's so unreasonable!
grammar: ~により indicates reason/cause; いたします is humble form of します

text: 可能な限り 原型をとどめて返却するよう努めますので
translation: We will make every effort to return it in its original condition as much as possible.
grammar: ~をとどめて means 'keeping/retaining'; ~よう努める means 'to try to/make effort to'

text: では ご協力 感謝いたします / いいわよ / レイ 持っていって
translation: Well then, thank you for your cooperation. / Fine. / Rei, take it with you.
grammar: いたします is humble form; ~ていって is te-form of ~ていく (action moving away)

text: 精密機械だからそーっとね
translation: It's precision equipment, so be gentle with it.
grammar: ~から indicates reason; ね at the end is a softening particle

text: しかしATフィールドをも貫くエネルギー算出量は
translation: However, the calculated energy output to penetrate even the AT Field is...
grammar: をも adds emphasis 'even'; は marks the topic

text: 最低1億8000万キロワット / それだけの大電力をどこから集めてくるんですか
translation: A minimum of 180 million kilowatts. / Where are we going to gather that much electrical power from?
grammar: それだけの means 'that much'; ~てくる indicates bringing/gathering toward speaker

text: 決まってるじゃない / 日本中よ
translation: It's obvious, isn't it? / From all over Japan.
grammar: ~じゃない at the end seeks agreement (isn't it?); よ is assertive particle

text: 番組の途中ですが / ここで臨時ニュースをお伝えいたします
translation: We interrupt this program / to bring you breaking news.
grammar: ~ですが indicates 'but'; お~いたします is humble honorific form

text: 本日午後11時30分より明日未明にかけて全国で大規模な停電があります
translation: Starting today at 11:30 PM through early tomorrow morning, there will be large-scale power outages nationwide.
grammar: ~より indicates starting point; ~にかけて means 'extending to/through'

text: 皆様のご協力をよろしくお願いいたします / 繰り返しお伝えいたします
translation: We ask for your cooperation. / We repeat...
grammar: よろしくお願いいたします is a humble polite request phrase

text: 本日午後11時30分より明日未明にかけて全国で大規模な停電があります
translation: Starting today at 11:30 PM through early tomorrow morning, there will be large-scale power outages nationwide.
grammar: Same structure as segment 44; repetition of the announcement

text: 皆様のご協力をよろしくお願いいたします
translation: We ask for your cooperation.
grammar: Polite humble request form with ご~を~お願いいたします

text: 敵シールド第7走行版を突破 / エネルギーシステムの見通しは? / 現在予定より3.2%遅れていますが / 本日23時10分には何とかできます / ポジトロンライフルはどう?
translation: Enemy drill has broken through armor plate 7. / What's the outlook for the energy system? / Currently we're 3.2% behind schedule, but / we can manage by 23:10 today. / How's the positron rifle?
grammar: ~ていますが indicates continuing state with 'but'; には marks time point

text: 技術開発部第3課の維持にかけても / あと3時間で形にしてみせますよ / 防御手段は?
translation: On the pride of Technical Development Section 3, / we'll make it work in 3 hours. / What about defensive measures?
grammar: ~にかけても means 'even if it means staking on'; ~てみせる shows determination 'I'll show you'

text: それはもう盾で防ぐしかないわね / これが盾ですか?
translation: Well, we have no choice but to defend with a shield. / This is the shield?
grammar: ~しかない means 'no choice but to'; わね is feminine confirmatory ending

text: そう、SSTOのお下がり / 見た目はひどくとも / もともと底部は超電池コーディングされている機種だし
translation: Right, a hand-me-down from the SSTO. / Even though it looks terrible, / the heat shielding was originally super-alloy coated.
grammar: ~とも means 'even though'; ~している indicates current state; だし gives reason

text: あの砲撃にも17秒は持つわ / 2課の保証書付きよ / 結構 / 狙撃地点は? / 目標との距離、地形、手頃な変電設備も考えるとやはりここです
translation: It'll hold for 17 seconds against that bombardment. / With Section 2's guarantee. / Good. / The sniping position? / Considering the distance to target, terrain, and convenient transformer facilities, it has to be here.
grammar: ~にも indicates 'even against'; ~を考えると means 'when considering'; やはり means 'as expected/after all'

text: 確かにいけるわ / ね / 狙撃地点は双子山山頂
translation: This will definitely work. / Right. / The sniping point is the summit of Mt. Futago.
grammar: いける is potential form used colloquially to mean 'it'll work'; わ/ね are feminine particles

text: 作戦開始時刻は明朝0時 / 以後本作戦を八島作戦と呼称します / 了解 / あとはパイロットの問題ね
translation: The operation start time is tomorrow morning at 00:00. / Hereafter, this operation will be designated as Operation Yashima. / Roger. / Now it's just a matter of the pilots.
grammar: 以後 (igo) = 'from now on, hereafter'; を〜と呼称します (wo ~ to koshō shimasu) = 'will be designated/called as ~'

text: 初号機パイロットの意識が戻ったそうです / 検査数値に問題なし / そう
translation: It seems the Unit-01 pilot has regained consciousness. / No problems with the test values. / I see.
grammar: 〜そうです (sō desu) = hearsay/reportative form 'it seems/I heard that'; に問題なし (ni mondai nashi) = 'no problem with ~'

text: では作戦は予定通りに / 了解 / でも彼もう一度乗るかしら / 双子山決戦急いで
translation: Then the operation will proceed as planned. / Roger. / But I wonder if he'll pilot again. / Futago-yama, hurry with the preparations.

vocabulary.meaning: to ride, to board, to pilot

grammar: 〜かしら (kashira) = feminine sentence ending expressing wondering/doubt; 通り (dōri) = 'according to, as per'

text: 綾波 / 明日午前0時より発動される
translation: Ayanami. / The operation that will be initiated tomorrow at 00:00 hours.
grammar: 〜より (yori) = 'from' (formal); される (sareru) = passive form of する 'to be done/initiated'

text: 八島作戦のスケジュールを伝えます
translation: I will relay the schedule for Operation Yashima.

vocabulary.meaning: to convey, to relay, to communicate

grammar: を伝えます (wo tsutaemasu) = 'will convey/relay ~' (polite form)

text: いかりあやなみの両パイロットは本日1730刑事に集合
translation: Both pilots Ikari and Ayanami will assemble today at 17:30.
grammar: 両〜 (ryō ~) = 'both ~'; に集合 (ni shūgō) = 'assemble at ~'

text: 1800初号機及び0号機起動
translation: 18:00, activation of Unit-01 and Unit-00.
grammar: 及び (oyobi) = 'and, as well as' (formal/written); time + event = listing schedule items without particles

text: 180号発進 / 同30双子山仮設基地到着
translation: 18:00, departure. / 18:30, arrival at Futago-yama temporary base.
grammar: 同 (dō) = 'same' (abbreviation for same day/hour); abbreviated schedule format with times and events

text: 以降は別名あるまで待機 / 明朝日付変更と同時に作戦行動開始
translation: After that, standby until further orders. / Tomorrow morning, commence operation simultaneously with the date change.
grammar: 〜まで (made) = 'until ~'; と同時に (to dōji ni) = 'simultaneously with ~'

text: これ新しいの
translation: This is a new one?
grammar: の (no) = nominalizer turning adjective into noun phrase; casual question without か

text: 寝ぼけて その学校で来ないでね
translation: Don't come half-asleep in your school uniform.
grammar: 〜ないでね (nai de ne) = 'don't ~ okay?' (casual prohibition with soft request marker ね)

text: ごめん
translation: Sorry.
grammar: Casual apology form (ごめん vs ごめんなさい)

text: 昨日から謝ってばかりいる
translation: I've been doing nothing but apologizing since yesterday.
grammar: 〜ばかりいる (bakari iru) = 'doing nothing but ~, constantly doing ~'; から (kara) = 'since'

text: 食事
translation: Food.
grammar: Single noun utterance (elliptical speech)

text: 何も食べたくない / 60分後に出発よ
translation: I don't want to eat anything. / We depart in 60 minutes.
grammar: 何も〜ない (nani mo ~nai) = 'not ~ anything'; 〜たくない (takunai) = negative desire 'don't want to ~'

text: またアレに乗らなきゃならないの / かな / ええそうよ
translation: Do I have to pilot that thing again? / I wonder... / Yes, that's right.
grammar: 〜なきゃならない (nakya naranai) = 'must ~, have to ~' (casual contraction of なければならない); かな (kana) = wondering/uncertainty

text: 僕は嫌だ / 綾波はまだアレに乗って怖い目にあったことがないからそんなことが言えるんだ
translation: I don't want to. / Ayanami, you can say that because you haven't yet had a scary experience piloting that thing.
grammar: 〜ことがない (koto ga nai) = 'have never ~'; から (kara) = 'because'; 〜んだ (n da) = explanatory emphasis

text: もうあんな思いしたくない / じゃあ寝てたら
translation: I don't want to go through that again. / Then why don't you just sleep?
grammar: もう〜ない (mō ~nai) = 'not anymore, never again'; じゃあ (jā) = 'then, well'; 〜たら (tara) = suggestion 'how about ~?'

text: 寝てたらって / 初号機には私が乗る
translation: What do you mean 'sleep'? / I'll pilot Unit-01.
grammar: 〜って (tte) = quotative particle expressing surprise/questioning; には (ni wa) = emphatic topic marker for contrast

text: 赤木博士が初号機のパーソナルデータの書き換えの用意しているわ / リツコさんが
translation: Dr. Akagi is preparing to rewrite Unit-01's personal data. / Ritsuko is?
grammar: 〜している (shite iru) = ongoing action/state; の (no) connecting multiple nouns in a chain

text: じゃあこちらに1位と赤木博士がケージ黙っているから
translation: Then just wait here quietly until the first lieutenant and Dr. Akagi come.

vocabulary.meaning: to be silent, to keep quiet

grammar: 〜ている (te iru) = continuous state; から (kara) = 'so, therefore'

text: さよなら
translation: Goodbye.
grammar: Standard farewell expression (more final than またね)

text: えらい遅いな / もう避難せなあかん時間やで / パパのデータをちょろまかしてみたんだ
translation: They're really late. / It's already time we need to evacuate. / I snuck a look at dad's data.
grammar: Kansai dialect: せなあかん (sena akan) = しなければならない 'must do'; やで (ya de) = だよ emphasis; 〜てみた (te mita) = 'tried to ~'

text: この時間に間違いないよ / せやけど出てけえへんな
translation: There's no mistake about this time. / But they're not coming out.
grammar: に間違いない (ni machigai nai) = 'there's no doubt/mistake about ~'; Kansai dialect: 出てけえへん (dete keehen) = 出てこない 'not coming out'

text: 山が動きおる / エヴァンゲリオンだ
translation: The mountain is moving! / It's Evangelion!
grammar: 〜おる (oru) = Kansai dialect for いる (continuous/ongoing action marker)

text: 頑張れよ
translation: Do your best!

vocabulary.meaning: to do one's best, to persevere

grammar: 頑張れ (ganbare) = imperative form of 頑張る; よ (yo) = emphatic particle

text: 頼むぜ
translation: We're counting on you!
grammar: 頼む (tanomu) = 'I'm asking you, counting on you'; ぜ (ze) = masculine emphatic particle

text: 敵シールド第17走行版を突破 / 本部到達まであと3時間55分
translation: The enemy drill has broken through the 17th armor layer. 3 hours and 55 minutes until it reaches headquarters.
grammar: まであと indicates 'until' with time remaining

text: 四国および九州エリアの通電完了 / 各冷却システムは試運転に入ってください
translation: Power transmission to Shikoku and Kyushu areas complete. All cooling systems, begin test runs.
grammar: 〜てください is a polite command form

text: 精密機械だから慎重にね
translation: It's precision equipment, so be careful.
grammar: 〜だから indicates a reason/cause. ね adds emphasis

text: でもこんな野戦向けじゃない兵器 / 役に立つんですか / 仕方ないわよ / 間に合わせなんだから / 大丈夫ですよね / 理論上はね
translation: But will a weapon that's not designed for field use be useful? / Can't be helped. It's a makeshift solution. / It'll be okay, right? / In theory.
grammar: 〜向け means 'designed for, intended for'. じゃない negates it

text: けど重心や加速器が持つかどうかは / 撃ってみないとわからないわ
translation: But whether the barrel and accelerator will hold up - we won't know until we fire it.
grammar: 〜かどうか expresses uncertainty. 〜てみないとわからない means 'won't know until trying'

text: こんな大出力で死者したこと一度もないから
translation: We've never fired it at such high output before.
grammar: 一度も〜ない emphasizes 'never even once'

text: 本作戦における各担当を伝達します / シンジ君 / はい / 初号機で宝石を担当 / はい
translation: I will now communicate each person's role in this operation. Shinji-kun. / Yes. / You'll handle sniping with Unit-01. / Yes.
grammar: における is a formal 'in, at, regarding'

text: レイは0号機で防御を担当して
translation: Rei, you'll handle defense with Unit-00.
grammar: 〜して is a casual command/request form

text: はい / テロリスの方が高いからよ / 今回はより精度の高いオペレーションが必要なの
translation: Yes. / Because the telemetry is better. This time we need an operation with higher precision.
grammar: より〜 indicates comparison 'more~'

text: 陽電子は地球の磁点、磁場、重力の影響を受け直進しません
translation: Positrons are affected by Earth's magnetic poles, magnetic field, and gravity - they don't travel in a straight line.
grammar: 影響を受け means 'to be affected by'

text: その誤差を修正するのを忘れないでね / 正確にコア一点のみを貫くのよ / そんなことか / まだ練習してないですよ / 大丈夫
translation: Don't forget to correct for that deviation. Pierce exactly one point - the core only. / I haven't practiced that yet! / It's okay.
grammar: 〜のを忘れないで means 'don't forget to~'. 〜のみ emphasizes 'only'

text: あなたはテキスト通りにやって / 最後に真ん中のマークが揃ったらスイッチを押せばいいの
translation: Just follow the manual. When the marks in the center finally align, just press the switch.
grammar: 〜通りに means 'according to, as per'. 〜ばいい means 'just do~, all you need to do is~'

text: あとは機械がやってくれるわ / それから一度発射すると冷却や再充填 / ヒューズの交換などで次に撃てるまで時間がかかるから
translation: The machine will do the rest. Also, once you fire, cooling, refilling, replacing fuses - it'll take time before you can fire again.
grammar: 〜てくれる indicates doing something for someone. 一度〜すると means 'once you do~'

text: じゃあもし外れて敵が撃ち返してきたら / 今は余計なことを考えないで
translation: So what if I miss and the enemy fires back? / Don't think about unnecessary things right now.
grammar: もし〜たら is a conditional 'what if~'. 〜ないで is 'without doing, don't do'

text: 一撃で撃破することだけを考えなさい
translation: Just think about destroying it in one shot.
grammar: 〜だけを emphasizes 'only~'. 〜なさい is a firm command form

text: 大ピンチってことか
translation: So it's a huge crisis, huh?
grammar: ってことか is casual for 'that means~, huh?'

text: 私 / は
translation: I... / Yes?
grammar: Interruption mid-sentence showing hesitation

text: 私は初号機を守ればいいのね / そうよ
translation: I should protect Unit-01, right? / That's right.
grammar: 〜ばいいのね is seeking confirmation 'I should~, right?'

text: わかりました / 時間よ / 二人とも着替えて / はい
translation: Understood. / It's time. Both of you, get changed. / Yes.
grammar: わかりました is formal past of 'understand'. 〜とも means 'both'

text: これで / 死ぬかもしれないね
translation: With this... we might die.
grammar: かもしれない expresses possibility/uncertainty

text: どうしてそういうこと言うの?
translation: Why do you say things like that?
grammar: 〜の is a question particle adding emotional nuance

text: あなたは死なないわ
translation: You won't die.
grammar: 〜ない is negative form. わ is feminine sentence-ending particle

text: 私が守るもの
translation: Because I'll protect you.
grammar: もの at sentence end gives explanation/reason

text: みんなとの強いんだな綾波は
translation: You're really strong, aren't you, Ayanami?
grammar: 〜んだな expresses realization/admiration. みんな might be 'really' (colloquial)

text: 私にはほかに何もないものほかに何もないって時間よ行きましょうじゃあさよなら
translation: I have nothing else. Nothing else... / It's time. Let's go. / Well then, goodbye.
grammar: 〜には indicates emphasis on 'for me'. もの gives explanation

text: ただいまより0時0分0秒をお知らせします
translation: Announcing 0 hours, 0 minutes, 0 seconds from now.
grammar: お〜します is humble/formal form

text: 作戦スタートです / シンジ君日本中のエネルギーあなたに預けるわ / 頑張ってね
translation: Operation start. Shinji-kun, I'm entrusting all of Japan's energy to you. Do your best.
grammar: 〜てね adds warmth/encouragement to commands

text: はい / 第1次 / 接続開始 / 第1から第803管区まで送電開始
translation: Yes! / First stage / Connection starting / Beginning power transmission from district 1 to district 803
grammar: から...まで pattern indicating range 'from...to'. ～開始 is a する-verb compound meaning 'to begin/start'

text: 電圧乗車中 河津駅へ
translation: Voltage rising, to Kawazu substation
grammar: ～中 (ちゅう) indicates an ongoing action 'in the middle of, during'. へ indicates direction 'to, toward'

text: 全冷却システム出力最大へ
translation: All cooling systems to maximum output
grammar: 全 (ぜん) prefix meaning 'all, entire'. へ particle indicating direction toward a state

text: 音の安定問題なし
translation: Sound wave stable, no problems
grammar: なし (無し) means 'without, lacking'. Noun + 問題なし is a common status report phrase

text: 溶電子流入順調なり 第二次接続
translation: Positron influx proceeding smoothly. Second stage connection
grammar: なり is a literary/formal copula equivalent to だ/です, often used in official announcements

text: 全加 / 速機運転開始 強制収束機 作動 / 全電力 双子山洞設変電所へ 第三次接続 問題なし
translation: All accelerators starting operation. Forced convergence unit activated. All power to Futago-yama temporary substation. Third stage connection, no problems
grammar: 全 prefix indicates 'all'. 仮設 (かせつ) means 'temporary, provisional'

text: 最終安全装置解除 激鉄を起こせ
translation: Final safety device released. Raise the firing pin!
grammar: を起こせ is the imperative form of 起こす (to raise). Imperative commands are common in military/technical contexts

text: 地球時点及び重力の誤差修正 プラス0.0009
translation: Error correction for Earth's magnetic field and gravity. Plus 0.0009
grammar: 及び (および) means 'and, as well as', used to connect nouns formally

text: 電圧発射点まであと0.2
translation: Voltage to firing point, 0.2 remaining
grammar: まであと～ pattern meaning 'until...remaining is ~'. Used for countdowns

text: 第7次最終接続 / 全エネルギーポジトロンライフルへ
translation: Seventh stage final connection. All energy to the positron rifle
grammar: へ particle indicates direction 'to, toward'. Used here for energy transfer destination

text: 目標に高エネルギー反応 / 何ですって / 2 / 1 / 発射
translation: High energy reaction from the target! / What!? / 2 / 1 / Fire!
grammar: 何ですって is an emphatic/shocked 'What!?' using って (casual quotative) with です

text: ミスター
translation: Missed!
grammar: English loanword ミス. The elongated vowel ー indicates the English pronunciation 'miss'

text: 敵シールド!ジオフロントへ進入! / 第2射!急いで!
translation: Enemy drill! Penetrating into the Geofront! / Second shot! Hurry!
grammar: ～て form (急いで) as an imperative 'hurry!' is softer than the direct imperative 急げ

text: ヒューズ交換!再重点開始! / 重心冷却開始!
translation: Fuse replacement! Beginning recharge! / Beginning particle cooling!
grammar: 再 (さい) prefix meaning 're-', indicating repetition. Multiple exclamatory commands in rapid succession

text: 目標に再び高エネルギ / ー反応! / まずい! / フォー! / シンチク!
translation: High energy reaction from the target again! / This is bad! / Four! / Shinji!
grammar: まずい is an i-adjective meaning 'bad/unfavorable', commonly used for dire situations

text: ハルナミ!
translation: Ayanami!
grammar: Character name called out in alarm

text: 盾が持たない!まだなの!? / あと10秒! / くっ、早 / く!
translation: The shield won't hold! Isn't it ready yet!? / 10 more seconds! / Damn, hur-ry!
grammar: ～が持たない means 'won't hold/last'. まだなの is feminine speech pattern adding の to まだ for emphasis

text: 早く!
translation: Hurry!
grammar: 早く as an adverb functioning as an imperative command 'hurry up!'

text: よっしゃ!
translation: Alright!
grammar: よっしゃ is a colloquial/dialectal variant of よし (good, alright), expressing triumph or determination

text: 早のみ!
translation: Ayanami!
grammar: Character name called out with concern

text: あやなみ!大丈夫か? / あやなみ!
translation: Ayanami! Are you okay? / Ayanami!
grammar: か as a question particle, often dropped in casual/urgent speech. 大丈夫か is a casual masculine way to ask if someone is okay

text: 自分には、自分には他に何もないって、そんなこと言うなよ
translation: That you have nothing else, that you have nothing else for yourself - don't say things like that
grammar: って is the quotative particle (casual form of と). ～なよ is a gentle negative imperative 'don't ~' (masculine speech)

text: 別れ際にさよならなんて、悲しいこと言うなよ
translation: When we part, saying goodbye like that - don't say such sad things
grammar: ～なんて minimizes or shows disdain for something 'something like ~'. Combined with negative command なよ

text: 払えばいいと思うよ
translation: I think you should just smile
grammar: ～ばいい is a conditional pattern meaning 'should just ~, it would be good if ~'. と思う adds 'I think'

text: 迫り来る使徒に対し民間の開発した人型兵器が制 / 御不能に陥る / 果たしてミサトは炉心誘拐を止められるのか / 次回人の作りしもの / お楽しみに
translation: Against the approaching Angel, a civilian-developed humanoid weapon falls out of control. Can Misato stop the core meltdown? Next episode: 'A Human Work'. Look forward to it!
grammar: 迫り来る uses the continuative form 迫り + 来る to mean 'approaching'. 果たして adds suspense 'will it really...?'. しもの is classical/literary form

translation: [silence/end marker]
grammar: Punctuation marker indicating end of audio segment
